Title.text: Set model for "Leah Kleschna," Manhattan Theatre, New York, 1904

Description.text: Set model of fifth act of "Leah Kreschna," an orchard near Neustadt, Austria. The Manhattan Theatre (not to be confused with Hammerstein's Manhattan on 34th between Broadway and 6th Avenue) stood at 6th Ave and 33rd St.

RepositoryName.text: Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University

Provenance.text: Gift, Gates and Morange

item.ItemType: Still ImagePhysical Dimensions: 24.5"x17.5"x15"

Title.text: Set model for "Les Deux Trouvailles de Gallus," Comedie Francaise, 1923

Description.text: Model of the setting for "Les Deux Trouvailles du Gallus," a combination of Victor Hugo's plays "Margarita" and "Esca."

RepositoryName.text: Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University

Provenance.text: Gift, Brander Matthews

item.ItemType: Still ImagePhysical Dimensions: 16"x21"x20"

Title.text: Model of the Drury Lane; London; 1778

Description.text: Depiction of the "screen scene" from "A School for Scandal" by Richard Brinsley Sheridan. Shows the use of wing and drop scenery on a deep stage, the depth of the forestage, proscenium doors, and stage boxes. Created by James P. Maginnis under the direction of Walter H. Godfrey, based on a contemporary print.

RepositoryName.text: Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University

Provenance.text: Gift, Robert E. Dowling

item.ItemType: Still ImagePhysical Dimensions: 16"x21"x20"

Title.text: Model of the Salle des Machines, theater in the Tuilieries, Paris, in 1671

Description.text: Represents a setting for "Psyche" by Moliere and Corneille, based upon a 1906 revival of the play at the Theatre Francaise. With B08, the model illustrates differing methods of staging in 17th century French theatre. La Salles de Machines was a large and extravagently-equipped theatre built by Gaspare Vigarani in a wing of the Tuileries.

RepositoryName.text: Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University

Provenance.text: Gift, Brander Matthews

item.ItemType: Still ImagePhysical Dimensions: 16"x21"x20"

Title.text: Model of the setting for "La Folie de Clidamant" by Alexandre Hardy as seen at the Hotel de Bourgogne, Paris, ca. 1630

Description.text: Shows the use of simultaneous settings at the Hotel de Bourgogne. With B11, shows differing methods of staging in 17th century French theatre. Based on sketch in "Le Memoire de Mahelot"; created by Davignaud and Gabin under the direction of Emile Perrin.

RepositoryName.text: Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University

Provenance.text: Gift, Clarence H. Mackey

item.ItemType: Still ImageOriginal Format: Rod puppetsOriginal Format: papier mache, metalPhysical Dimensions: 10.5" (21")

Description.text: Sicilian rod puppet operated from above. Face, legs of painted wood or plaster. Hands of metal. Armor, shield, sword, scabbard of unpainted tin decorated with copper and brass lions atop helmet, on shield and breastplate. Skirt of white silk with metallic tape trim and spangles. Breeches of lavender. A red and green feather plume attached to helmet.
Scholar suggests made in Palermo.
Conservation assessment: Stable

Source.text: Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Columbia University

Conservation assessment: Stable

Source.text: Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Columbia University
